title: Using Blockchain for cash distribution in Jaleshwor
sub_head: In collaboration with UNICEF Office of Innovation, UNICEF Nepal, and the Rumsan team, a blockchain- based digital cash and voucher pilot was implemented in Jaleshwor, Madhesh Pradesh, Nepal. Rahat, the blockchain solution developed by Rumsan, strengthened humanitarian aid efforts by promoting financial inclusion, accountability, and transparency throughout the cash transfer process.

title: Stationery Package Distribution at Sitapaila using Blockchain Technology
sub_head: Funded by the Nepal Government, Shree Sitapaila Secondary School located in the Nagarjun municipality, provides education with minimal fees to a total of 700 students from kindergarten to grade 12.

title: Cash Distribution to Unbanked Population using Blockchain Technology
sub_head: Shyam Bahadur Nagarkoti lives by himself in a makeshift tent built by a reconstruction team after the 2015 April Earthquake in Nepal. He used to be a farmer but lost his eyesight five years ago, leaving him crippled and unable to move freely on his own terms.

title: Cash & Voucher Distribution to Underprivileged Students of Government School
sub_head: From February 26, 2022 to 21st March 2022, the Rahat team completed its 14th pilot in one of the government school i.e. Shree Chandi School, Chakupat, Lalitpur. With a total of 32 beneficiaries (the students),

title: Stationery Support to Government School Students
sub_head: On January 21, 2022, the Rahat team commenced its 13th pilot in one of the government school i.e. GeetaMata Secondary School in Swoyambhu area. With a total of 50 beneficiaries, three vendors,  one aid agency and one donor.

title: Rahat Native Vendor App used for Aid Distribution at NAXAL
sub_head: On December 31, 2021, the Rahat team completed its 12th pilot with a total of 20 beneficiaries, one vendor, and three social mobilizers.

title: Rahat App used for Cash and Aid Distribution at Dumre
sub_head: The Rahat team has previously conducted a number of pilot testing and recently it commenced its 11th pilot on November 19, 2021, and ended on November 26, 2021, in collaboration with volunteers from the local mobilizer organization,

title: Relief for Old Aged and Female Labourers through Rahat App
sub_head: Rahat has completed its 10th pilot project testing OTP code timings and efficiency of Social Mobilizer App. Rahat team has been focusing on underprivileged communities to provide relief aid that includes, labourers, school students,

title: Supporting underprivileged students providing educational materials
sub_head: Rahat team collaborated with Kabhre Banepa Leo CLub (KBLC) of Banepa, Kabhre to distribute educational supplies as a relief package to under privileged students through the Rahat system using Rahat vendor app.

title: Support to Maternity and Child Support
sub_head: Rahat team collaborated with local communities, Rural Community Health Care (RCHC) of Humla to distribute nutritional food items as a relief package to maternity through the Rahat system.

title: Support to Physically Challenged people at Godawari
sub_head: Rahat team collaborated with local communities of Godawari to distribute relief materials to beneficiaries who are physically challenged through the Rahat app.

title: COVID-19 Aid Distribution at Bandipur-5 using Blockchain Technology
sub_head: On June 13 2021, Rahat team collaborated with local communities of Bandipur to distribute relief materials to beneficiaries affected by Covid-19 through the Rahat app in Bandipur-5.

title: COVID-19 Aid Distribution at Dumre, Nepal using Blockchain based app “Rahat”
sub_head: With the COVID-19 crisis, the livelihood of low income Nepali communities have been more adversely affected. The second wave in Nepal has been deadlier leading to prolonged lockdowns across the country.

title: COVID-19 Aid Distribution at Chitwan, Nepal using Blockchain based app “Rahat”
sub_head: Humanitarian aid at such times becomes vital to provide relief. However, providing relief becomes more challenging after disasters strike. With the limitations in infrastructure and services in the rural and remote areas,

title: COVID-19 Aid Distribution at Naxal & Kalanki, Nepal using Blockchain based app “Rahat”
sub_head: Natural disasters and pandemics such as Covid-19 create challenging situations for anyone affected- especially underprivileged and vulnerable communities.
